Unfortunately it did not come close to meeting my expectations. When we checked in and got to our room - there was basically some sort of plumbing issue that had completely backed up into our sink. Yuk! - we called the front desk and they promptly came to clean it up. But that wasn't the end of it. We were promised by the website a large flat screen TV. - true, but it didn't really work. Each time I turned it on, it would immediately turn back off. I finally figured out that if I turned it on and immediately changed the channel it would stay on. But then when I turned it off, it turned itself back on. Bizarre. We were also promised wi-fi, which again - DID NOT WORK! Neither did the in-room radio system. sigh. The room was quite small and while they had tried to update the look - the remodel was done on the cheap! The rain style showers drizzled water that was either burning hot or ice cold - and again, hard to turn off and on as the nozzle turned endlessly in either direction. The room layout was OK but it was very dark and dank. And while the room was supposed to have a king size platform bed - they obviously went cheap and bought some sort of irregular sized mattress for a big discount. The platform itself was king sized, but the mattress ended more than a foot before the end of the platform. Turns out it was only 6 feet long - MUCH shorter than a King and my poor boyfriend spent the night with his feet hanging off the end! Oh yeah, and there is basically no parking available. When we complained, the staff was quite rude and unhelpful to us. The service was definitely amateurish. We didn't have any food or drinks - so if you are looking for a bar - this might be a good place to go as the bar was busy at night. BUT DO NOT STAY HERE - there are plenty of nice hotels on Shelter Island and Harbor Island, don't waste your money in this dump.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful minimalistic design, poorly finished bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: a_na_na_ba
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about the price of this hotel; here I was getting the opportunity to stay in a 3-4 star hotel for the price of a 2 star hotel over a weekend in winter (winter in Southern California is like my Washington's summer). I went to the hotel's website before I made the booking to see what it was all about and it looked like a very swanky place to stay complete with gorgeous interior styling and H20 bath products (I'm such a sucker for products). When my friend and I got there it was quite late at night as I'd flown down to San Diego after work and the club lounge downstairs was lively with lots of drunk beautiful people. We were a little bit unclear about where to check in, reception is actually just inside to the left away from the lounge. We then walked upstairs past the pool and outdoor film screen to go to our room where we were in for a great surprise. We walked in the door and there was a huge king size pillow top mattress above a platform bed complete with high thread count sheets, the flat screen tv fixed to the wall and tasteful furniture choices in the chairs and side tables located in the room all left a smile on our faces. The star of the room was "Scooter" a tropical fish who has his own spotlight (we didn't want to leave it on too long in case Scooter became crispy)! It all sounds great doesn't it? and it really is, until you walk into the bathroom. The fittings were quite nice but the tiles were in need of replacing and the tub needed refinishing. The water pressure was minimal which makes it tricky to rinse the lather created by the lush shampoo and conditioner. A few changes would help maintain the standard set everywhere else in this hotel and bring it from 3-4 stars to something more special. Parking is a little bit tricky too, like us, you might get lucky with street parking but otherwise space is limited so be prepared for that. We had fun testing out the advertised "sturdiness" of the beds (the fittings over the storage components of the headboard make them a little noisy) and all in all it was a great experience...hopefully the owners complete the renovations of the bathrooms sometime soon for an even more enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluescissors76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Pearl for our honeymoon. I read all the reviews before we went, so I was under no illusions that this would be a quiet place, a luxurious place, or a perfect hotel. We had never stayed at a non-chain, and I wanted to check it out anyway. We really enjoyed our stay. We checked in on a Monday, and not too many guests were staying on a Monday. I was prepared to ask for a room away from the pool area if necessary, but we got one without asking. (Number 17.) It was near a side street, so street noise wasn't too bad, but we had to run the AC at all times because the room got really stuffy if we did not, and the AC was very loud. Still, if you don't mind loud fans running, that doesn't seem like a big deal to me. Plenty of chain hotels are the same way. Some of the rooms are RIGHT next to the pool. I wouldn't have liked to stay in one of those rooms. A few of the reviews mentioned that there was no place for breakfast nearby. This is not true (or I guess it may be true depending on your definition of breakfast). A Starbucks and a smoothie place are about two blocks away, and there was another restaurant that appeared to be serving breakfast maybe 3-4 blocks away, although we did not check it out. It is not the most pedestrian-friendly area, but it is possible to get to these places without an automobile. Also - the restaurant does have coffee available in the mornings. They set up a coffeepot at the bar. One day the cleaning people did not clean the room while we were out, but I was able to find someone to ask about getting clean towels in the meantime, and the cleaning crew was still around, so the room was cleaned when we went out again later. The food at the restaurant was phenomenal. I had this mushroom risotto that was just wonderful, and the drinks were great too. We ended up splurging for a daily guaranteed parking spot. It was our honeymoon, after all. I think it was $25 a day. This required us to ask someone to move a cone to our spot after we left for the day, but after the first time we just did it ourselves rather than bother anyone. Street parking seemed to be relatively available, but it was still nice to have that guaranteed spot and not have to worry about it. We paid in cash, and they were not really equipped to handle payment in cash. They didn't have any change, and the bar was not open. Fortunately we didn't really need the change, so we just told them to tip the cleaning crew. All in all, it was a unique experience for a honeymoon, and I'm glad we took a chance on a new place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel1985
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about staying at The Pearl because of the bad reviews I read...but had no choice because everything else was booked. DON'T LISTEN TO THOSE BAD REVIEWS!! This hotel was beautiful, classic, different, CLEAN, hip...everything was great. The hotel is a mix between classy 60's and modern style! Loved the staff because they were so friendly and helpful. We arrived 2 hours early and they still let us check in and offered to take our bags upstairs to our room. Check-out isn't till 12:00 and let me tell you that extra hour helps. The hotel WAS NOT noisy like other reviews said...and I was there for the weekend! I love this place and will stay here every time I come to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay”
Reviews.Author: BargainGirl82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Pearl for one night and enjoyed it very much. We called early in the day to see if we could have an early check in and they told us no problem. We checked in and the guy at the front desk was super nice. I had booked the smallest room through hotels.com and because they didnt have any ready when we checked in, they upgraded us to the next biggest, which was nice. The rooms are on the smallish side, but we didnt really care about the size. The bed was nice and big and comfy and the flat screen was cool. Everything was retro-modern which was a nice change from all the generic cookie-cutter hotels out there. We stayed over a Sunday night in the winter season so it wasnt too busy and was very quiet. The only downside I would mention is the thin walls, so if you are bothered by hearing your neighbors, you probably wouldnt enjoy this hotel. I would recommend this to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling Decieved”
Reviews.Author: travelsdSanDiego
Reviews.Content: First of all, Orbitz states that this property is entirely non-smoking which is not the case. There was smoke everywhere when we arrived. The lobby was like an ashtray. When we went up to look at the room, same thing...very unfriendly odor. They advertise this "motel" as a hotel that honestly looks like an apartment complex. The owner added some modern deco, touched up his photos, and then gave it a 4-star rating. We had to park two blocks from the property because there were only 5 parking spaces that were all taken. Not sophisticated in the least; more like cheesy. We live in San Diego and my husband and I (early 40's) wanted to get away for the weekend. We are use to paying for $200-$300 rooms in nice hotels in the downtown area. When we arrrived and saw the condition of this property, we asked for a refund, and they refused. Beware...the information and pictures on Orbitz website are deceiving. Don't stay here just to be in Point Loma. Take a taxi if you have to. One should definitely be very comfortable with all lifestyles, as heterosexuals are not the norm in this motel environment.

Reviews.Title: “For the early-20s crowd”
Reviews.Author: 1974LA
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I go to San Diego for weekend trips every so often and I love to try new (to me) places. I looked around and did a lot of research on local hotels and was really excited to snag a room here. We usually stay at bigger chains like the W, Westin or Omni, but I thought a little boutique hotel (that is in the fun Point Loma area) would be a nice change. Unfortunately it didn't quite work out as hoped. The average rates for 2-star chains (Ramada, et al) are about $150. Higher end (W, Hard Rock, Omni) are about $300. This was in the high middle, about $255 after taxes. The girl on the phone offered me a free room upgrade (from queen bed to king), which was nice of her. I also signed up for the "essentials package" (free parking plus 1 appetizer and 2 drinks at their restaurant/bar) for an additional $35. Essentials package is fine for the money - if you want the drinks and apps. Parking was nice, because the street parking is hard to come by on a weekend. Good news is there's free wireless internet. Better news is that ll of the staff are really cool, friendly and accommodating. From the check-in girl (who saved a parking spot for me in the tiny lot with her own car) to the bartender (who took good care of me, even though she was slammed with a party), they all were really sweet and ran their butts off taking care of the guests. Best part was that the food was surprisingly delicious. We had late-night snacks, desserts and drinks in our room and were THRILLED. The hotel is TINY. There's a tiny pool surrounded by tiny rooms. Our room had a king bed (quite comfy) that nearly took up the whole space. The shower was nice (love the rain showerhead), except that it was a little grimy. Could have been cleaner. It was noisy because the bar is around the pool, which is 4-feet from our door. We had to keep the blinds closed or the bar people could see right in. Weird. Luckily the air-conditioning unit was really loud (in a good way) and drowned out the people noises. We slept really well. The unfortunate part is is that the website makes it look WAY cooler than it is. It looks like a groovy mid-century hotel (like the fabu Horizon in Palm Springs) that offers a chill time. Maybe lounge around the pool and kick back with a mai tai and some fondue. Re-reading their website after the fact, they do mention a "spirited nightlife scene" and that "occasionally, the energetic buzz of good times can be heard in-room..." and that, "...care is taken to limit sound levels." Um, okay? I don't know if there's a college around there, or something, but this was basically a frat party. It's 20-somethings running a hotel and bar that caters to 20-somethings. Definitely go there if you A) want to be in Point Loma, B) like to party and be loud, C) are 21-30, D) get a rate of $160 or less, or 5) can sleep through noise. Overall a decent enough place. Just not worth the money I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Someone is stuffing the ballot box for The Pearl!”
Reviews.Author: PikePlaceTraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked The Pearl for a weekend stay based on TripAdvisor reviews. Having stayed there this past weekend, I have to share a suspicion: I think someone has been stuffing the ballot box in favor of The Pearl. The Pearl doesn't deserve the glowing reviews that it has received -- and I suspect that they are bogus reviews aimed at pumping up this ridiculous property. The Pearl is not a boutique hotel -- it is a renovated MOTEL. It's basically a dozen rooms circling a tiny pool. The management has tried to doll the place up, but the upgrades are very meager. My room felt like a cleaned up basement. The "platform King bed" looked as though it were resting on packing pallets! The entire place screams "motel". The staff was generally courteous, but neglected to tell me that I'd pay an extra $15 for parking in the "parking lot" -- which was nothing more than a parking strip off of Rosencranz. That's "service"? In short: do not trust the hype either here or on The Pearl's website. This place is a MOTEL with pretensions at being a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing find...”
Reviews.Author: abogart72
Reviews.Content: This retro vibed boutique hotel was an amazing find. However, I should say that I don't really think it's family friendly, and I'm pretty sure my 62 year old mother wouldn't want to stay there. It is super cool, hip, funky, and very, very LOUD at night. The room was fairly small, but decorated with innovative style (fish in a wall sconce). I found the bed very comfortable, my husband found it too soft. Dinner was really tasty, but as we didn't have reservations for dinner (?) we had to eat at the bar, since it was "Dive In Movie" night. This takes place on Wednesdays, and is a cool idea-showing a hip older movie on a big screen over the pool. It was PACKED. We were fine at the bar, got really fast service, and had one too many blue-cheese stuffed olive martinis. Thursday night was even louder, I think some game or karaoke was going on til about midnight. In addition, road noise was quite loud in our room as well. Staff was very helpful-Jose in particular gave us the ins and outs of San Diego. Public transportation was right across the street, and we were given maps and internet information when we asked. Overall, I would stay here again, and recommend it, but I would ask for a room further from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hip Place”
Reviews.Author: DavidMVictoria_BC
Reviews.Content: We discovered this gem online. The staff are fantastic. Everything exceeded our expectations. The bar was cool and retro, and really happeing on the night we came in. The drinks we great as were the people. Get Smart (the original) ran on a large screen over the pool. The room was fantastic, small but great, from the live fish to large screen lcd, comfortable bed and pillows. Art for a great cause was for sale on the walls. Everything about this little place is perfect. I would stay there again in a heartbeart. I cannot recommend it highly enough. David

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't stumble, to The Pearl in Point Loma!”
Reviews.Author: Mindimer
Reviews.Content: They've completely redone an old sailor's dive into a very hip, very funky little gem with a sense of humor. The rooms feature platform beds, fishbowl lighting fixtures with actual fish in them, 36-inch flat panel TV's on the wall, free-standing showers, and very comfortable and happening furnishings. They also boast a Dive-In Movie, where they show movies on a huge screen on the second floor railing over the pool. There are huge beach balls floating all over the pool and poolside service. Omigod how I wished it were later in the year and the pool was heated. It is heated later in the year, but damn the luck for coming in February. We love this place and will be coming back. For special occasions, be sure to reserve #9, The Strand, a huge room with living area, desk, and balcony. The best part? If you stumble in after midnight, you can get any unsold room for $79. Beat that. Daddy-O.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool and hip little spot”
Reviews.Author: LeslieOC
Reviews.Content: I adored this place- If you are into retro/hip mid century modern establishments, this is the place for you. It is basically a two story completely renovated 60's era motel. The new owners spared no expense to give it a cool vibe. Awesome lobby bar/poolside cafe. Driftwood front desk, colorful italian bissaza tile in the showers, and great spa shampoo products. Minimal and Special is how I would describe this place- you will remember having your own named pet in your room-(A colorful beta in a glass wall sconce with a name placard. This place is fun.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel For Those Who Want To Party”
Reviews.Author: Reekas_Travels77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Pearl when we were in San Diego. It's in a great location - San Diego attractions are nearby and the airport is also very close. POSITIVES: - The staff is quite friendly and helpful. - The design and look of the hotel is very hip and cool. - You get an XBox 360 free of charge to play in your room. - The rooms all have a pet Beta fish in them which was a nice touch. - Great bar scene. NEGATIVES: - It's LOUD. The bar scene there is very popular and the rooms are nearby and you can hear everything. The music is loud and so are the voices from the bar. - You have to valet your car ($15/night) if you cannot find parking on the street. - Rooms are very small. If you are claustrophobic, do not stay here. - No room service. - If you need to check out early, let them know the night before, there may be no one a the front desk the next morning if you do not tell them you need an early check out.

Reviews.Title: “"Simply Marvelous, Darling!"”
Reviews.Author: ModelChick
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with an overnight get-away (minus the kid!!! Ha, ha) at this quaint boutique hotel. Now if you're looking for a tired business lounge with computers, etc. go to a boring businessy type of hotel, but if you are looking for something different & fun then read on! For me, The Pearl conjures up moods of old black & white Hollywood glamour, those cool now-famous collectible 1960's HIGGINS glassware pieces, thoughts of Frank Sinatra lounging like a lizard with a Cuban fatty, or images of Marilyn Monroe & Dorothy Dandrich wearing taboo fox fur shawls with the heads & paws still attached! (Sorry vegans). The only difference is that The Pearl has been beautifully updated without bastardizing or compromising the original 1960's design, architecture or flare! It is truly a Boutique Hotel in that it offers "unusualities" (my pet word for: unique or unusual amenities) that other hotels may not. For instance, they have a Movie Night! You can lounge, have a gourmet meal or go tapas style out by the pool, all while watching classic movies on a huge screen! Inside you'll find next to the concierge, a cool shag carpeted area with board games to play with. As well, they have an outdoor side patio with a Zen water fountain and a large table that would seat a nice-sized dinner party. The Pearl really almost has a home-like feel to it, because of the cozy floor plan layout. But I can't close without mentioning something my husband didn't even realize before taking me here...the food is excellent! They should really push to the public that they truly offer a full restaurant and bar! Plus if you have dinner, you can get a room (if you are not pre-booked) for a huge discounted price, if there is availability after a certain time (I think almost 50% off!!!). The menu is definitely impressive and tasty to boot! Our room was a corner room #9, I hear it is the owner's fav! Well, it's now ours too! It had cool, simple lines, airy, stylish colors and great tile/wallpaper design, not to mention a truly comfortable platform bed. I also loved the unexpected balcony just off the living room/tv area, where my husband & I enjoyed our early morning coffee overlooking the pool. Overall, I should be giving them a 9 score and that is only becuase they were still in construction at the time of our stay and they could use much brighter/visible signage, but I loved it so much that I'll go ahead and give them a perfect 10!!! I will definitely be back for many more stays and for certain, start coming to their Movie Night!! The Pearl is just that: A Pearl!!!

Reviews.Title: “W or Ian Schrager on an intimate level.”
Reviews.Author: wadams
Reviews.Content: We are San Diegans and heard the buzz about this hotel from an architect who made a point to stay there with several other architects. So I took my wife there as a belated birthday present. If you are a design buff, especially mid-century or modern, you get it. Some people just won't get it since there are numerous run of the mill roadside franchise hotels nearby. Its a wonderfully not-overdone restoration/modernization of a late 50's or early 60's hotel, with all the best parts preserved. At the front, its not immediately obvious that its different from its more modest neighbors. The first clue that this is something different is the valet service. Next is the upscale restaurant, in of itself unusual in an under 50 room hotel. The restaurant is very open-air and resort like, with seating spilling out around the pool; and with an architecturally blended movie screen over the pool on which mid-century classics are shown during evening hours (we saw 007 Dr. No). Dinner was long and liesurely, since the surroundings were so comfortable. We just didn't want to leave - not to mention that our room was just accross the pool. The room (#9 - "The Strand") was large with a sofa seating area large enough to be its own room, a wide plasma tv, and a balcony overlooking the pool. The bed was nice and firm, the sheets and bedding clean, the bathroom facilities large, modern and luxurious (what do you call those wide ceiling showerheads and separate handheld shower nozzles?). The design throughout is mid-century modern yet warm - about the best I've seen this genre done. What also amazed me was the great number of interesting spaces and amenities packed into a hotel of this size. Lots of lounges, board games, balconies, nooks, and items of visual interest - all in earth and water tones, giving a feeling of warmth. There are even beach cruiser bicycles for guest use. The staff was very friendly and attentive (and probably saved our two year old's life). The location is close to the harbor, and central to downtown, the beaches, and San Diego attractions. About the only complaint I had was unavoidable due to its newness - i.e., the fresh paint and carpet smell. Anyway, think the Dub-U or one of those hip little South Beach hotels - at about half the price, but for my money better. But if your just looking for an adequate place to crash, without interest in an onsite restaurant, heated pool, or other little luxuries, you can stay accross the street. But if you want more, this is a great alternative to the newest downtown hotels at half the price.
